action: I want to accurately apply for transportation and business trip expenses incurred during work
reason: Because I need to ensure proper reimbursement of advanced funds and achieve transparency and fraud prevention in accounting processes
acceptance_criteria: The system shall allow only authenticated users with the 'Employee' role to submit expense claims.
The system must automatically associate the logged-in User ID with the application and generate a unique Application ID.
The system shall require the selection of an Expense Type from a predefined master list, strictly prohibiting free-text entry for types.
The system must validate that the Amount is a numeric value greater than zero.
The system shall display a warning if the entered Amount exceeds a pre-configured corporate threshold.
The system must require a mandatory Expense Date and trigger a warning for future dates.
The system shall limit the Description to 500 characters and sanitize the input to prevent Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).
The system must support receipt image uploads restricted to JPG, PNG, and PDF formats with a configurable file size limit.
The system shall execute a virus scan on uploaded files and store them in encrypted storage.
The system must manage application statuses (Draft, Submitted, Approved, Rejected, Remanded) and restrict editing to the 'Draft' state only.
The system shall facilitate an approval workflow via 'Supervisor' roles, strictly prohibiting self-approval.
The system must record the Approver ID and Timestamp for every approval action.
The system shall require a mandatory reason for Rejection and allow comments for Remand actions.
The system must maintain a complete, tamper-evident history of the approval process.
The system shall implement fraud detection mechanisms to identify duplicate receipt images, suspicious amount patterns, and consecutive identical claims.
The system must alert administrators upon detecting applications flagged for potential fraud.
The system shall enforce strict input validation for API requests, mirroring the frontend logic.
The system must utilize an ORM or parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection.
The system shall enforce CSRF protection, HTTPS (TLS 1.2+), and rate limiting for all interactions.
The system must log all successful and failed application attempts, including the User ID in the audit log.
The system shall support data integration with the accounting system and automatically generate monthly summary reports.
The system must target an API response time of under 400ms and adhere to REST architectural principles.
The system shall maintain audit logs even for logically deleted records, following the corporate data retention policy.
